Generation V.Black: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.
Generation V.White: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.
Generation V.Black 2: It glides on its outstretched membrane while shocking foes with the electricity stored in the pouches on its cheeks.
Generation V.White 2: It glides on its outstretched membrane while shocking foes with the electricity stored in the pouches on its cheeks.

Generation VI.X: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.
Generation VI.Y: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.

Generation VII.Sun: It glides using its cape-like membrane. Electrical energy scatters from it, shocking its friends and foes alike.
Generation VII.Moon: It grills berries and bug Pokémon with electric shocks and makes a meal of them. It usually nests in the holes gouged in trees by Pikipek.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: They store up electricity to fly through the air. When thunder cracks at night, sometimes there are almost enough of them to blot out the sky.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: As it flies, it scatters electricity around, so bird Pokémon keep their distance. That's why Emolga can keep all its food to itself.

Generation VIII.Sword: As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can cause a lot of trouble.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries. Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much food that it can't fly properly.

Generation V.Black: Routes 5 , 6 , 7 , 9 , 10 , 11 , 12 , 13 , 14 , 15 , and 16 , Dragonspiral Tower , Village Bridge , Giant Chasm , Abundant Shrine , Lostlorn Forest ( rustling grass ) Trade Boldore on Route 7
Generation V.White: Routes 5 , 6 , 7 , 9 , 10 , 11 , 12 , 13 , 14 , 15 , and 16 , Dragonspiral Tower , Village Bridge , Giant Chasm , Abundant Shrine , Lostlorn Forest ( rustling grass ) Trade Boldore on Route 7
Generation V.Black 2: Routes 5 , 6 , 7 , 9 , 11 , 12 , 13 , 14 , 15 , 16 , 22 , and 23 , Dragonspiral Tower , Village Bridge , Abundant Shrine , Lostlorn Forest ( rustling grass )
Generation V.White 2: Routes 5 , 6 , 7 , 9 , 11 , 12 , 13 , 14 , 15 , 16 , 22 , and 23 , Dragonspiral Tower , Village Bridge , Abundant Shrine , Lostlorn Forest ( rustling grass )

Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Forest of Focus Loop Lagoon ( Max Raid Battle ) Max Lair ( Dynamax Adventure )
